page.title: Human rights in Egypt under the Supreme Council of the Armed Forces

rev.diff:
Line 15: Line 15:
At the Israeli Embassy in Cairo on 15 May, [[2011 Nakba Day|thousands gathered for a demonstration]] but were dispersed by Egyptian security forces and the Egyptian army police forces using tear gas and live fire.<ref name="Bikya">{{cite web|url=http://bikyamasr.com/wordpress/?p=33601 |title=Army fires on Cairoâs Nakba rally |publisher=Bikyamasr.com |date=2011-05-17 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref> Some 353 protesters were injured and 180 arrested.<ref>[http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/440439 Rights organization urges release of Nakba protesters]. ''[[Al-Masry Al-Youm]]''. 17 May 2011.</ref> At least two of the wounded had been shot in head and chest by Egyptian forces, and at least two of those arrested (''Mosa'ab Elshamy'' and ''Tarek Shalaby'') were well known for their [[Twitter]]s during the [[2011 Egyptian revolution]].<ref name=Bikya/> All those who were arrested faced military trials and were later freed.
At the Israeli Embassy in Cairo on 15 May, [[2011 Nakba Day|thousands gathered for a demonstration]] but were dispersed by Egyptian security forces and the Egyptian army police forces using tear gas and live fire.<ref name="Bikya">{{cite web|url=http://bikyamasr.com/wordpress/?p=33601 |title=Army fires on Cairoâs Nakba rally |publisher=Bikyamasr.com |date=2011-05-17 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref> Some 353 protesters were injured and 180 arrested.<ref>[http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/440439 Rights organization urges release of Nakba protesters]. ''[[Al-Masry Al-Youm]]''. 17 May 2011.</ref> At least two of the wounded had been shot in head and chest by Egyptian forces, and at least two of those arrested (''Mosa'ab Elshamy'' and ''Tarek Shalaby'') were well known for their [[Twitter]]s during the [[2011 Egyptian revolution]].<ref name=Bikya/> All those who were arrested faced military trials and were later freed.
â
Seven thousand civilians<ref>http://thedailynewsegypt.com/human-a-civil-rights/egypt-cant-move-forward-without-justice-says-amnesty-sec-gen.html</ref> to ten thousand civilians<ref>http://www.guardian.co.uk/commentisfree/2011/jun/22/egypt-army-military-tribunals</ref> were tried in military tribunals in the last four months, according to HRW.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/465795 |title=Rights groups says Egypt still needs more change | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=1 June 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> One of them is Amr El Beheiry.<ref name="Associated">{{cite web|last=Associated |first=The |url=http://wvgazette.com/ap/ApInternational/201105270558 |title=Egypt activists plan 'Second Revolution' - AP World News - The Charleston Gazette - West Virginia News and Sports |publisher=Wvgazette.com |date=27 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> Beheiry was arrested during a violent military dispersal of a sit-in at the parliament on 26 February.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2011/may/27/world/la-fg-egypt-prisoners-20110527 |title=Egypt democracy protests: Egyptian activists plan protests over military trials - Los Angeles Times |publisher=Articles.latimes.com |date=27 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> He was then referred to military court and after a swift trial without the presence of attorneys,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/451026 |title=Activists continue their battle against military trials as SCAF releases detainees | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=25 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> where he received a sentence of five years on thuggery charges despite the testimonies of many eyewitnesses who said he broke no laws.<ref>{{cite web|author=Evan Hill |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2011/05/2011519172611166398.html |title=Egypt's crackdown now wears camouflage - Features |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=20 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> Amnesty International also has called for Beheiry's release.<ref name="Associated"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/05/19/egypt-human-rights-abuse-_n_864027.html |title=Egypt Human Rights Abuse Continues: Amnesty |publisher=Huffingtonpost.com |date= |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref>
+
Seven thousand civilians<ref>{{cite web|url=http://thedailynewsegypt.com/human-a-civil-rights/egypt-cant-move-forward-without-justice-says-amnesty-sec-gen.html |title=Egypt can't move forward without justice, says Amnesty sec-gen |publisher=Thedailynewsegypt.com |date= |accessdate=2011-07-07}}</ref> to ten thousand civilians<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/commentisfree/2011/jun/22/egypt-army-military-tribunals |title=The Egyptian army's mask has slipped | Austin Mackell | Comment is free | guardian.co.uk |publisher=Guardian |date=2008-05-29 |accessdate=2011-07-07}}</ref> were tried in military tribunals in the last four months, according to HRW.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/465795 |title=Rights groups says Egypt still needs more change | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=1 June 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> One of them is Amr El Beheiry.<ref name="Associated">{{cite web|last=Associated |first=The |url=http://wvgazette.com/ap/ApInternational/201105270558 |title=Egypt activists plan 'Second Revolution' - AP World News - The Charleston Gazette - West Virginia News and Sports |publisher=Wvgazette.com |date=27 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> Beheiry was arrested during a violent military dispersal of a sit-in at the parliament on 26 February.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2011/may/27/world/la-fg-egypt-prisoners-20110527 |title=Egypt democracy protests: Egyptian activists plan protests over military trials - Los Angeles Times |publisher=Articles.latimes.com |date=27 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> He was then referred to military court and after a swift trial without the presence of attorneys,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/451026 |title=Activists continue their battle against military trials as SCAF releases detainees | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=25 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> where he received a sentence of five years on thuggery charges despite the testimonies of many eyewitnesses who said he broke no laws.<ref>{{cite web|author=Evan Hill |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2011/05/2011519172611166398.html |title=Egypt's crackdown now wears camouflage - Features |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=20 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> Amnesty International also has called for Beheiry's release.<ref name="Associated"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/05/19/egypt-human-rights-abuse-_n_864027.html |title=Egypt Human Rights Abuse Continues: Amnesty |publisher=Huffingtonpost.com |date= |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref>
Another Activist the has been detained is Loai Nagati.<ref name="ahram3">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/15393/Egypt/Politics-/Loai-Nagati-another-Egyptian-activist-to-face-mili.aspx |title=Loai Nagati: another Egyptian activist to face military trial - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-07-01}}</ref> [[We are all Khaled Said|We Are All Khaled Said]] facebook page wrote: "Loai Nagati is a 21 years old Egyptian Activist who got arrested during Tahrir protests yesterday morning. As it has become the norm now, Loai has been sent to 15 days in a military jail awaiting a military investigation! Loai didnât have a lawyer, has no clear accusation against him & is a computer science student. He is a civilian & shouldnât be investigated by military prosecuters. End military trials of civilians in Egypt NOW! 45 protesters have been arrested so far during Tahrir protests on 28 June night & 29 June morning. All sent to military trials."<ref>{{cite web|title=Loai Nagati is a 21 years old Egyptian Activist|url=http://liveword.ca/egypt/2011/06/30/24076/|publisher=http://liveword.ca/|accessdate=2 July 2011}}</ref> An active tweeter, Nagati was tweeting (@LoaiNagati) from Tahrir Square about what was taking place when he was arrested. âSeveral people are injured,â was the last tweet by Nagati at 7am on Wednesday.<ref name="ahram3">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/15393/Egypt/Politics-/Loai-Nagati-another-Egyptian-activist-to-face-mili.aspx |title=Loai Nagati: another Egyptian activist to face military trial - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-07-01}}</ref> Nagati is to be detained for 15 days and was transferred on June 29 to military prison pending a military trial.<ref name="elbadil1">{{cite news|title=Ø´ÙÙÙ ÙØ¤Ù ÙØ¬Ø§ØªÙ ÙØ¹ØªÙÙ Ø§ÙØ³Ø¬Ù Ø§ÙØ­Ø±Ø¨Ù Ø§ÙÙØ±ÙØ¶ Ø¨Ø§ÙÙÙØ¨: ÙÙØ¹ÙÙÙ ÙÙ Ø¥Ø¯Ø®Ø§Ù Ø£Ø¯ÙÙØ© ÙÙ ÙØ·Ø§ÙØ¨ØªÙÙ Ø¨Ø§ÙÙØ¨Ø¶ Ø¹ÙÙ ÙØ£Ø¯Ø®Ù Ø§ÙØ¯ÙØ§Ø¡|url=http://elbadil.net/%D8%B4%D9%82%D9%8A%D9%82-%D9%84%D8%A4%D9%8A-%D9%86%D8%AC%D8%A7%D8%AA%D9%8A-%D9%85%D8%B9%D8%AA%D9%82%D9%84-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B3%D8%AC%D9%86-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AD%D8%B1%D8%A8%D9%8A-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D8%B1/|accessdate=2 July 2011|newspaper=http://elbadil.net/|date=1 July 2011}}</ref> Nagati has a heart condition as well as digestive problems which require 10 different medications, and after some struggle, an officer who works at the prison agreed to the the medication to Nagati.<ref name="elbadil1"/>
Another Activist the has been detained is Loai Nagati.<ref name="ahram3">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/15393/Egypt/Politics-/Loai-Nagati-another-Egyptian-activist-to-face-mili.aspx |title=Loai Nagati: another Egyptian activist to face military trial - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-07-01}}</ref> [[We are all Khaled Said|We Are All Khaled Said]] facebook page wrote: "Loai Nagati is a 21 years old Egyptian Activist who got arrested during Tahrir protests yesterday morning. As it has become the norm now, Loai has been sent to 15 days in a military jail awaiting a military investigation! Loai didnât have a lawyer, has no clear accusation against him & is a computer science student. He is a civilian & shouldnât be investigated by military prosecuters. End military trials of civilians in Egypt NOW! 45 protesters have been arrested so far during Tahrir protests on 28 June night & 29 June morning. All sent to military trials."<ref>{{cite web|title=Loai Nagati is a 21 years old Egyptian Activist|url=http://liveword.ca/egypt/2011/06/30/24076/|publisher=http://liveword.ca/|accessdate=2 July 2011}}</ref> An active tweeter, Nagati was tweeting (@LoaiNagati) from Tahrir Square about what was taking place when he was arrested. âSeveral people are injured,â was the last tweet by Nagati at 7am on Wednesday.<ref name="ahram3">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/15393/Egypt/Politics-/Loai-Nagati-another-Egyptian-activist-to-face-mili.aspx |title=Loai Nagati: another Egyptian activist to face military trial - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-07-01}}</ref> Nagati is to be detained for 15 days and was transferred on June 29 to military prison pending a military trial.<ref name="elbadil1">{{cite news|title=Ø´ÙÙÙ ÙØ¤Ù ÙØ¬Ø§ØªÙ ÙØ¹ØªÙÙ Ø§ÙØ³Ø¬Ù Ø§ÙØ­Ø±Ø¨Ù Ø§ÙÙØ±ÙØ¶ Ø¨Ø§ÙÙÙØ¨: ÙÙØ¹ÙÙÙ ÙÙ Ø¥Ø¯Ø®Ø§Ù Ø£Ø¯ÙÙØ© ÙÙ ÙØ·Ø§ÙØ¨ØªÙÙ Ø¨Ø§ÙÙØ¨Ø¶ Ø¹ÙÙ ÙØ£Ø¯Ø®Ù Ø§ÙØ¯ÙØ§Ø¡|url=http://elbadil.net/%D8%B4%D9%82%D9%8A%D9%82-%D9%84%D8%A4%D9%8A-%D9%86%D8%AC%D8%A7%D8%AA%D9%8A-%D9%85%D8%B9%D8%AA%D9%82%D9%84-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B3%D8%AC%D9%86-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AD%D8%B1%D8%A8%D9%8A-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D8%B1/|accessdate=2 July 2011|newspaper=http://elbadil.net/|date=1 July 2011}}</ref> Nagati has a heart condition as well as digestive problems which require 10 different medications, and after some struggle, an officer who works at the prison agreed to the the medication to Nagati.<ref name="elbadil1"/>
